New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers became the first team since the 2015-16 Golden State Warriors to start a season 13-0.
Cleveland Cavaliers are the sixth team in NBA/BAA history to start 13-0.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored 23 points, 14 rebounds, and nine assists.
Darius Garland led the Cavaliers with 25 points.
Jared McCain scored a career-high 34 points.
Pre-Game Insights: Donovan Mitchell emphasized the importance of staying focused despite the 13-0 start.
Cleveland Cavaliers' success is based on ball movement and scoring with multiple players averaging double figures.
Post-Match Reflections: Kenny Atkinson highlighted the team's maturity and steady performance.
The Cavaliers' 13-0 start is a good test for the rest of the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland Cavaliers will face upcoming challenges including a game against Boston Celtics.
The team's depth and player contributions were significant in their victory.
Others: The article mentions the Cavaliers' historical achievements and their impact on the season.
